author: Zeyna Benbrahim El Andaloussi
title: Into the deep self
excerpt: "Into the Deep Self" is an introspective multimedia installation, intertwining spirituality, creativity, and reflection within the aesthetic of journaling, inviting participants on a 15-minute immersive journey of self-discovery through the symbiotic elements of belief, creation, and growth, fostering introspection while exploring themes of fluidity of time and the balance between stillness and stimuli.

author: Yi-Chun Lan
title: Surveillance Synthesis
excerpt: Which scenario elicits greater fear: a physical break-in by a thief who steals and then departs, or the invisible presence of someone who can access your private space digitally at any moment without your knowledge?

author: Elodie Liu
title: Say Chee!
excerpt: A web-based virtual pet game experience, including a website and a Google Extension.

author: Vera Liqian Zhong
title: PCB (Printed Comic Boards)
excerpt: Learn about electronics as if they were people, like us: with their own personalities, quirks, and roles in their system/society.

author: Lisha Nie
title: Do Nothing Compaany
excerpt: Do Nothing Company a project centered around a conceptual company that hires people to practice doing nothing. We work through loving ourselves.

author: Maria Paz Martinez
title: Graffiti Re-imagined: Augmented Reality in Urban Spaces
excerpt: tbd

author: Steve Sun
title: In and out of touch (working title)
excerpt: How do we think of physical objects? What are the properties of the objects and their surroundings that we take notice of? What do our interactions say about ourselves? In this project, I hope to explore those questions through interviews and video documentations.

author: An-Kai Cheng
title: Artedex
excerpt: A geo-based art collection game to help you explore the city.

author: César Loayza
title: Despierta. To Our Survival.
excerpt: How can an intimate, immersive story contribute to others' healing journeys of inner child wounds? "Despierta. To Our Survival" is my personal and emotional story about reconnecting with your inner child. It explores waking up from being kidnapped by family wounds and constant external battles. Let's cheer together for our survival.

author: Chumou Zhang
title: HexaVenture
excerpt: HexaVenture merges sustainable design with aerodynamics to innovate passive cooling, reducing reliance on traditional air conditioning and slashing energy use and emissions in moderate climates. It promotes the use of sustainable material properties and efficient air circulation to provide scalable, environmentally friendly solutions for diverse communities around the world.

author: Daniel Wai
title: Symbiosis
excerpt: An exploration of interactive design and generative arts. Allowing audiences to play with creature-like game systems and try and understand it.

author: Jaxon (Zidong) Wang
title: Let there be ambience
excerpt: A desktop object that creates existing ambient companionship.

author: Micaelle Lages
title: The Great Conjuring
excerpt: This research and, ultimately, the art piece explores the evolving concept of magic, from a tool and practice for understanding the unknown to a word for describing complex technologies. An immersive installation, featuring AI-generated nature visuals, invites visitors to embrace this magic state of mind, forgotten knowledge and fosters a reconnection with nature.

author: Queenie Huang
title: Objective View of Contested Collection
excerpt: A meta-exhibition allowing visitors to embody a museum object from their own cultural context in approaching the topic of repatriation, the discussion of returning objects to its origin. By experiencing the process and recontextualization an object undergoes, it prompts an empathetic lens in relating personal experiences to the complexities attached to contested objects.

author: Karina Chow
title: Pharmi (WIP)
excerpt: An in-home robot to provide therapeutic care and companionship to the ever growing population of lonely individuals. Approved by Big Pharma and Big Tech*.

author: Sam De Armas
title: Head Break
excerpt: Head Break is a virtual reality experience utilizing hand tracking technology, facilitating seamless immersion for newcomers and skeptics by removing barriers to entry typically associated with complex VR controllers.

author: Dror Margalit
title: Context
excerpt: Context is an AI-powered learning platform that allows artists and designers to learn creative coding through interactive experiences tailored to their learning goals, needs, and preferences.

author: Zeynep Elif Ergin
title: Beyond
excerpt: A video installation that explores the presence of the unseen photographer and others behind the camera.

author: Zoe Margolis
title: Untitled
excerpt: How does our relationship with our personal technology change as the technology changes? Do we really have control over it, or do the companies making the technology control us?

author: Anna Nikaki
title: STATES
excerpt: Why do we feel compelled to document our lives, and which memories do we want to save for the future. How can these be brought back into the physical world?

author: Briana Jones
title: there’s nothing here worth dying for.
excerpt: Motherhood? Scary. Caves? Also scary.

author: Alfonssette Joselin Medina Bonilla
title: Compa
excerpt: Loneliness and stress, exacerbated by the pandemic and declining social connections, pose significant risks to mental health. By applying recent scientific research, the Compa app aims to promote meaningful social interactions in the digital age. Adapting the concept of pen pal correspondence, Compa helps users cope with loneliness and stress through a platform designed to foster authentic connections.

author: Kay Wasil
title: Boundless
excerpt: Boundless is an exploration of PCB boards and LEDs as decorative, wearable art, and seeks to highlight the form factors of various electrical components rather than trying to embed or hide them behind other materials.

author: Rob Ryan
title: Cone of Silence 2.3
excerpt: The Cone of Silence is one of many recurring joke devices from Get Smart, a 1960s American comedy television series about an inept spy. The cone is real.

author: Dongxu Xie
title: There was a thing, originally
excerpt: This immersive VR project serves as a vivid portal into the cultural origins and folklore of China's Northeast, inviting viewers to journey through the region's rich history and spiritual practices.

author: Chenghong Tang
title: Interactive Diorama
excerpt: My project aims to create interactive dioramas by incorporating sensors and technology to enhance user engagement through immersive experiences.

author: Chiang Hsu
title: Gadgets to Live By
excerpt: In our fast-paced world, Gadgets to Live By invites you to pause—simple yet significant reflection through design.

author: Sarah Mok
title: Sense making
excerpt: By focusing on the tactile qualities and inherent characteristics of materials and surfaces, I seek to create dynamic expressions of form, unveiling new dimensions of communication and engagement with our surroundings.

author: Yu Lee
title: null: there is always room
excerpt: "Null: There is Always Room" is a web art project that explores the creative possibilities inherent in the concept of the 'null' value in computer programming. In programming, 'null' represents an absence of a value or a placeholder, often signifying a state of indeterminacy or emptiness. This project reimagines 'null' not as a limitation, but casts it as an expansive and liberating space, serving as both a sense of comfort and a sanctuary for those navigating uncertainty or feeling marginalized within societal frameworks.

author: Haoquan Wang
title: Dolĉa Morto: An Experimental Fashion Line Exploring Digital Design & Virtual Production Campaign
excerpt: Dolca Morto explores integrating digital design tools(Clo3D & Marvelous Design), with Virtual production techniques (Unreal Engine & LED Wall), into traditional fashion workflows. This experiment aims to determine if digital media advancements can speed up fashion industry workflow, enhance efficiency, and expand creative freedom for fashion professionals in this digital era.

author: Long L
excerpt: This project, named 1642, brings music to Rembrandt's painting, The Night Watch.

author: Michelle Ma
title: Blue Desert
excerpt: Blue Desert is an experimental film entirely rendered with Unreal Engine with tactile experience. Through its cinematic form and non-linear storytelling captured in a virtual world, I hope to reconstruct and bridge the irrevocable temporal fissure through the agency of my metahuman, bringing the mother and daughter together through and above time as a concept.

author: Han Zhang
title: Cytokinesis
excerpt:
In an enclosed room where one holds their keys,
the flesh-pink intimacy becomes sticky
a bed splitted to half,
placed at the two poles like two cells divided from the parental whole,
with membranes form between,
dermis like analog screens,
who am I when you are present,
am I still the same person, the same body
that takes up its own space,
or is it eaten by your invasiveness,
What is this invisible membrane
that veils partially of your presence from me?
I am and I become myself,
With your present,
and we are two wholesome beings
body and mind

author: Xiaotian Zhang
title: Programmable Cassette
excerpt: TBD

author: Lang Qin
title: TacTag- Tactile Feedback Prototype Toolkit
excerpt: The TacTag Toolkit provides haptic interface designers with modular hardware and a web GUI for innovation. It streamlines the creation and testing of tactile sensations, offering six default sensations, including squeezing, tapping, and rubbing. Designers can interchange modules and customize patterns through the web GUI to discover more sensations, enhancing early design development and facilitating remote collaboration.

author: Cindy Hu
title: The Green Tablet
excerpt: The Green Tablet presents a collection of objects grown from research into the assemblages around lithium.

author: Bosung Kim
title: RIMEDO
excerpt: This project enables users to gauge their financial acumen by comparing their investment, spending, and salary decisions with peers through a singular, insightful query and comparative analysis interface.

author: Becky Hsu
title: PowerUp Fitness – AI powered workout App
excerpt: Designed for beginners and busy lifestyles, our app effortlessly guides you to outdoor workouts, provides affordable home exercise videos, and customizes fitness plans with Augmented Reality, AI, and a supportive chat community, making staying active simple and engaging.

author: Xiaoran Chen
title: Natural Resonance: Emotional Landscapes in VR
excerpt: This VR meditation experience leverages dynamic geometric patterns and immersive natural environments in Unity to guide users through a meditation journey that alleviates anxiety, embraces change, and promotes joy and focus, showcasing the power of VR to transform mental and emotional well-being.

author: Mathew Olson
title: Playces
excerpt: Video games, as an interactive art medium, are capable of creating a striking sense of place for audiences. I believe this characteristic has been under-explored in curatorial explorations of games as art objects, and in response created a series of works that focus on this idea and celebrate the craft of level design.

author: Michelle Mong Qi Wu
title: I'm tired of cleaning your mess
excerpt: A human-robotic arm performance that explores the artist's frustration with technology

author: Anna Lin
title: soft network
excerpt: Soft Network is a speculative exploration of a question: what if, rather than embodying the efficiency of automation brought by machines, personalized technology embraced our humanness by serving our desire to touch instead, acknowledging its deep-rooted historical tie to the practice of weaving soft materials meant for our bodies?

author: Hank Hsu
title: Gadgets to Live By
excerpt: In our fast-paced world, Gadgets to Live By invites you to pause—simple yet significant reflection through design.

author: Keyi Fu
title: If "YOU" do manipulate, then I'm innocent.
excerpt: An interactive website showcasing opinions on 'Fate' from people with diverse backgrounds.

author: Anvay Kantak
title: Storytime
excerpt: Storytime is an interactive storytelling experience that uses toylike miniatures with projection mapping and on-screen animations to create a surreal environment to bring a digitally illustrated story into the physical world.

author: Josh Zhong
title: Burp World Online
excerpt: Burp World Online is an exploration of sound design as interface design. By reimagining the online social space as one that is free of the distraction of screens and visual social biases, it fosters a new way of interacting with the computer and with each other through sound, voice, and listening.

author: Shauna Wu
title: Purrify
excerpt: Purrify is a cute plant pot that sits on your window sill and acts as an air quality sentinel for you and your pet who might be dust sensitive.

author: Jo Suk
title: interdepend.net
excerpt: interdepend.net is a website that is only accessible when a human generates enough power to start the server.

author: Jane Cheng
title: Spectral Signatures
excerpt: This project redefines signatures from static marks to dynamic expressions, animating individual traits into living identities. By challenging traditional perceptions, it explores the deep connections between identity, creativity, and visual representation, sparking dialogues on human complexity and digital artistic innovation.

author: Junru Chen
title: Silent Whisper
excerpt: “Silent Whisper” —an immersive analogy of human societies to magnetic systems, advocating for the importance of external observation in understanding cultural and social dynamics

author: Bingrui Fan
title: Timeless Echoes
excerpt: This thesis leverages Unreal Engine 5.3 and motion capture technologies to narrate Ellie's symbolic journey through time, blending ancient symbols and digital storytelling to explore the human quest for meaning, legacy, and transcendence within the temporal confines of life, death, and eternity.

author: Dipika Titus
title: Identity in Transit: The Journey of an Immigrant
excerpt: An immersive interactive installation capturing the Immigrant experience and simulating the feeling of being an outsider.

author: Dre Jacome
title: earthseed
excerpt: Earthseed is an immersive, intimate storytelling structure powered by interactive stars, ecological architecture, and reciprocal oral history excerpts that speak on abortion, gender transitions, and kinship.

author: Levitia Patricia
title: I'll Meet You at the Rainbow Bridge
excerpt: An evocative web-based virtual world designed to help individuals navigate the often-underestimated pain of pet loss.

author: Alexandra Palocz
title: Provenance
excerpt: Provenance is a tactile-audio narrative experience for one person in the dark. It follows the story of a girl who finds a mysterious artifact and the search for its true home.

author: Nima Niazi
title: Nardin
excerpt: A musical device that makes use of real-time audio effects changes to generate musical patterns.

author: Gracy Whelihan
title: TEst Thesis project
excerpt: test

author: Lily Crandall
title: A Familial Juncture
excerpt: A visual and tactile exploration of my experience researching my family’s history working at 370 Jay Street, the former MTA headquarters which is now the home of ITP.

author: Mashi Zaman
title: Community Canvas
excerpt: Community Canvas is a website for New Yorkers to visualize new ideas for public spaces in 3D.

author: Tom Xia
title: Distance within Light
excerpt: How can a motion-responsive ceiling screen in a public space alter perceptions of distance and movement, and create a new sensory experience?

author: Orpheas Kofinakos
title: AxAR: An Augmented Reality Guitar Learning Tool
excerpt: This project performs research in the area of alternative music learning tools within XR, taking into account and trying to eliminate the cost factors of additional hardware that have been used in similar previous work.

author: Hyungin Choi
title: Connected- disconnected
excerpt: "Link" is a VR experience where user choices shape multiple endings, exploring three human facets. It encourages players to connect those places by making choices in the given circumstances. Players navigate to uncover connections between these three worlds. ( or they can opt for a shorter journey.) With a mysterious atmosphere and immersive sound design, the project aims to deliver an ??? experience.

author: Eric Cheng
title: Seed is Power
excerpt: "Seed is Power" redefines the retail experience, using the humble tomato to narrate its own story, fostering a connection between consumers and the origins of their food.

author: Andriana Mereuta
title: A Synthesis of Everything I Care About
excerpt: A tapestry of love testimonies on the spectrum of human and sacred experiences shared in a ‘confessional’ setting to foster connection in the very process of sharing and deep listening in the presence of another.

author: Elaine Wang
title: Tide
excerpt: We align multiple pieces of transparency acrylic board with laser-cut curves, and it shows an integrated image in the front view. We also use the automata mechanical structure to drive all the acrylic boards up and down one by one.

author: Andre Lira
title: Laser Painter
excerpt: The Laser Painter is a realtime artwork visualization installation for representing user input by taking digital drawings a user is making and displaying them in real time with a UV Laser "painting" on a glow in the dark mesh sheet.

author: Yizhi Liu
Elyana Javaheri
excerpt: <in progress>

author: Isabel Lee
title: Bread Winner
excerpt: A browser-based idle clicker game that gamifies and satirizes our obsession with digital productivity.

author: Aliza Habib
title: What she carried
excerpt: Archiving oral history of the partition as a communal tool to understand grief and generational trauma.

author: Yuke Ding
title: My Dear Friend
excerpt: This is a dancing performance depicting the way modern friendship evolves through time and distance. From becoming friends in school to living on the opposite side of the globe, two protagonists support and care for each other. This is a piece aimed to celebrate friendship — a often undervalued relationship in today’s world.

author: Priyanka Makin
title: Body of Work
excerpt: pee pee poo poo

author: Nakyung Youn
title: Bio Material Research
excerpt: The experimenting with bio based plastic is not easily approachable, since it requires some equipment and hard to control the quality. Using the DIY kit, user can access the material without the lab equipment or recipe of the materials. All they need is a boiling pot and they can dump the pod into the pot.

author: Karen Gordon
title: Visible Somatic Self
excerpt: Thesis Statement: In light of this multifaceted transformation, this thesis seeks to delve into the dynamics of authentic human connection amidst our digital age. Specifically, it aims to explore how leveraging technology can serve as a catalyst for fostering genuine connections by encouraging individuals to reveal their inner selves, thereby sparking meaningful conversations.

author: Kitty Guo
title: Magical☆Rhythmie
excerpt: Magical☆Rhythmie is a 2D rhythm JRPG for Windows. Players take the role of a high school girl who can transform into a magical girl.

author: Ranna Adhikari
title: Senstory: A multisensory Book Experience
excerpt: Senstory is a multi sensory novel for anyone who likes to read which has philosophical excerpts accompanied with sensory elements that can stimulate the five senses to make the narrative more immersive.

author: Wendy Ho
title: TravARlog
excerpt: How can we create a platform that leverage extended reality to unite people through shared experiences, also providing a unique dimension for storing and sharing their significant memories?

author: Austen Li
title: Light: AI companion powered by therapy method
excerpt: Light, your AI companion for mental wellness. With our app, embark on a journey of self-discovery and growth through affordable, AI-guided sessions inspired by Cognitive Behavioral Therapy. Unpack your thoughts, reflect, and find solutions in a safe, therapeutic environment. Light ensures privacy while offering invaluable support. Start your journey today towards a brighter, healthier mind.

author: Yu-Ying Lee
title: null: there is always room (for not making a choice)
excerpt: Inspired by "Becoming NULL: Queer relations in the excluded middle," Null: There is always room (for not making a choice) aims to expand null's creative potentials and human aspects in terms of life struggles and decision making, symbolizing an open space—a sanctuary for those who struggle to make decisions or find themselves without suitable options.

author: Zeyna Benbrahim El Andaloussi
advisor: Karalyn C Lathrop,  Emily Conrad,  CHIKA
title: Into the deep self
excerpt: an introspective , multisensory experience that invites the audience in an immersive room where they experience my personnal narrative, through breathable animations, documentary film , photography and projection mapping, inviting them to meditate on their own.

author: Peter Zhang
title: Limen
excerpt: Limen is a two-part experience examining the liminality of career transitions and the power of community. Part I features an immersive VR experience going through a series of personal narrative scenes depicting users’ mental states during an emotional liminal space. Part II features a mentorship and community-building mental wellness app for connecting individuals through shared liminality and common interests.

author: Riho Hagi
title: null
excerpt: By storing DNA on a blockchain, where it can't be altered and is preserved forever, I've achieved digital immortality, living eternally within the blockchain. This project highlights the grotesqueness and eeriness of humanity's age-old desire for immortality.

author: Athena Zhou
title: Tangible Values
excerpt: Tangible Values is a digital gallery space for direct interaction with thought experiments, providing a dynamic environment for exploration and contemplation.

author: Maryia Markhvida
title: It's never me
excerpt: TBD

author: Jessica Shen
title: Jess's Thesis (untitled, TBD)
excerpt: You are here, now, and your presence and impact has a meaningful impact on others.

author: Haonan Qi
title: low-tec-futurism
excerpt: Another future where few would distract us from pursuing tranquility.

author: Neeti Sivakumar
title: Social Protocols
excerpt: How does communication technology affect one’s ability to be vulnerable? The term vulnerable, within the scope of this thesis, addresses the willingness for reciprocity and self-disclosure. How do you choose to tell someone you love them: texting them a heart emoji, texting them you love them, sending a voice note, calling them, or telling them in-person?

author: Shiqing Chen
title: Temporary Spaces
excerpt: Through exploring and documenting different kinds of temporary, non-permanent spaces in urban construction, I hope to arouse people's attention and curiosity to some seemingly permanent and inevitable things around them.

author: Sam Hafferty
title: Rebuttal Tracker
excerpt: A web application to engage local communities with issues of transparency & consent raised by the expansion of automated policing infrastructure in Brooklyn, New York.

author: Teresa L Wang
advisor: Sharon De La Cruz,  Sharon De La Cruz
title: Thesis (title TBD)
excerpt: _TITLE_explores the dual meanings of the word subject: to come into being as a subject and to be subjected to.

author: Lily Yu
title: The Echoes Unheard
excerpt: “The Echoes Unheard” immerses audiences in an interactive digital soundscape that captures the poetic essence of marginalized dialects and the deep personal connections they hold for the artist. It unveils the rich artistic and cultural narratives hidden within these languages.

author: Simran Chodavarapu
title: An Expression of Flow
excerpt: A visual representation that captures the essence of the state of flow while spreading awareness about the nature of an experience that is universally attainable.
